sub_title: Chief Metrologist Flow at VSL National Metrology Institute
summary:
In my current position I went back to my flow and volume metrology roots but now at a management level as Chief Metrologist Flow. 

I can help you with flow measurements by showing how metrology benefits you and your company by gaining and keeping control over your (flow) measurements.

My first task (September 2022) as Chief Metrologist Flow is to complete the construction and move of the volume laboratory and flow meter calibration facilities in Rotterdam called the European Center for Flow Measurement. 

My personal goal is to give customers the best possible experience when their flow meters, volume instruments, flow calibration facilities or other instruments are calibrated and made traceable to the National Standards of the Netherlands.

We as teamVSL can take care of almost all your needs in Metrology not just Flow. Next to performing calibrations we advise, calculate measurement uncertainty, teach and coach you how to measure better or set up a calibration service. As the National Metrology Institute (NMI) of the Netherlands we have a lot of knowledge that you can use in your day to day business. 

I have visited many companies around the world in all kind of industries. I will remain doing this as I am transferring my knowledge (29+ years) to you and new VSL team members in this field of metrology. Some of the companies I worked for now use a special designed logo of VSL when performing calibration of instruments. This service is called “VSL CMC Certified” and is being introduced in more fields of metrology. 

If you read this I would like to invite you to try our services if you are not our customer yet. I am sure our enthusiastic sales and operation teams will be more than happy to help you.

treasury_media.title: Financial risks in dynamic LNG measurement - by Erik Smits VSL
treasury_media.description:
When measuring LNG there can be financial risks. In the video I try to explain how to minimize these risks for your company.

More info about VSL's and our LNG facility can be found here:

treasury_media.title: LNG Flow Meter Calibration
treasury_media.description: Worlds 1st calibration facility for #LNG #Flow meters and test site for LNG #sampling systems. If you want to know more contact us at VSL National Metrology Institute. We can calibrate your flow meters to minimize the financial business risks for flow meters that are under reading making you give product away. We can do a presentation for you through teams to show you more about this service and facility. Take control of your cryogenic #metering and keep control on your #mass balance.

treasury_media.title: Het belang van LNG-metingen voor de aankomende energietransitie - PT Industrieel Management
treasury_media.description: Over de hele wereld zien we de impact van een veranderend klimaat, ook hier in Nederland. De gemiddelde temperatuur over de laatste eeuw is gestegen, er valt meer neerslag en zeer warme dagen komen steeds vaker voor. De overstap naar schonere, duurzame energiebronnen, ook wel bekend als de energietransitie, krijgt wereldwijd steeds meer aandacht.

treasury_media.title: Delftse primeur met testcentrum vloeibaar aardgas
treasury_media.description: Steeds vaker wordt vloeibaar aardgas (LNG) gebruikt ter vervanging van vervuilende brandstoffen. In Delft is nu een kalibratiecentrum voor LNG geopend: een wereldprimeur.

treasury_media.title: VSL video: Chemistry metrology at VSL
treasury_media.description: Laboratories that analyze natural gas and gas phase samples continually strive to ensure the quality of instruments, procedures, and capabilities. Systematic deviations can often go unnoticed leading to unreliable and therefore erroneous results. All this can be solved by use of gas certified standards and by participation in interlaboratory comparisons...

projects.title: Euramet Supplementary Comparison liquid volume – 500 mL and 5000 mL volumetric glass flasks
projects.description:
Supplementary comparison for liquid volume calibrations with two volumetric glass flasks. For the 500 mL volumetric glass flask the contained volume will be determined and for the 5000 mL volumetric glass flask the delivered volume is determined. The volume is calculated for a reference temperature of 20 °C at its reference line using the gravimetric method.

15 Participating partners have agreed to take part in this comparison.

contributors.headline: Chief Metrologist Flow at VSL National Metrology Institute

projects.title: Supplementary comparisons (BIPM)  EURAMET.M.FF-S6 / Euramet project 1157 Inter-comparison of 1000 L proving tank
projects.description:
Read the Draft B report.

During the EURAMET TC Flow meeting, held in Scotland in March 2010, it was agreed to start a comparison with a 1000 L proving tank in order to compare results, uncertainties and calibration methods. Both the gravimetric method and the volumetric method were used by several laboratories. 

Within EURAMET it is the first time that a comparison is organised in the large volume capacity range. So far there has been only EURAMET comparisons in the µL range, and volumes of 100 mL, 5 L and 20 L. Compared to small volume standards the calibration of large proving tanks involves a number of circumstances that may vary considerably between the laboratories (type and preparation of water and its actual temperature, control of surrounding air temperature and humidity, practical handling, different surface conditions inside, techniques to read the scale, use of balance or volumetric standards etc.)

In September 2013 Euramet project 1157 was added as a supplementary comparisons at BIPM with as reference EURAMET.M.FF-S6. Next to this it is published in the technical supplement 2013 of Metrologia (http://iopscience.iop.org/0026-1394/50/1A/07013).

projects.title: Key-Comparison (BIPM) CCM.FF-K2.1.2011 Hydrocarbon and water flow from 5 kg/min to 60 kg/min
projects.description:
The purpose of the Key-Comparison (KC) for “Water” and “Hydrocarbon” flow measurement is to support the Calibration and Measurement Capabilities (CMC) of the participating National Metrology Institutes as part of the CIPM MRA. VSL is the pilot laboratory and I am the project manager.

Participating NMI's:
BEV (Austria)
NRC-INMS-Measurement Canada (Canada)
CMS (Chinese Taipei)
PTB (Germany)
NMIJ/AIST (Japan)
KRISS (Korea)
VSL (The Netherlands)
TUV NEL (UK)
NIST (USA)

Project will be ready at the end of 2015 or early 2016.

contributors.headline: Chief Metrologist Flow at VSL National Metrology Institute

projects.title: Euramet project 1072 Bilateral comparison of water flow measurement standards with volume flow-rates from 0.5 m³/h to 40 m³/h and mass flow-rates from 4.36 t/h to 40 t/h
projects.description:
Read draft B report.

The purpose of this bilateral comparison of water flow measurement standards is to support the Calibration and Measurement Capabilities (CMC) of the Bulgarian Institute of Metrology (BIM-NCM). This comparison has been performed under the framework of Euramet (known as project number 1072). The aim of the comparison was that the measurement errors at different flow-rates between the two water flow measurement standards found using two flow meters did not exceed the summed CMC claims of the two water flow measurement standards according the En value calculation for bilateral comparisons (En<1). VSL was the pilot laboratory for the bilateral comparison due to the fact that VSL has an entry in the International Bureau of Weights and Measures (BIPM) Mutual Recognition Arrangement (known as the CIPM MRA) for water flow measurement. For this bilateral comparison VSL has used Euramet Guide no. 3 ―Euramet Guidelines on Conducting Comparisons‖. In addition VSL has followed the technical aspects of ILAC guideline G13 ―ILAC Guidelines for the Requirements for the Competence of Providers of Proficiency Testing Schemes‖

contributors.headline: Chief Metrologist Flow at VSL National Metrology Institute
Operational Manager Calibration Laboratory at Royal Netherlands Meteorological Institute - KNMI

projects.title: Key-comparison CCM.FF-K1.2015 Water flow 30 to 200 m3/h
projects.description:
The purpose of Key Comparison KC1 for water flow measurement (CCM.FF-K1.2015) was to support and prove the Calibration and Measurement Capabilities (CMC) of the participating National Metrology Institutes and Designated institutes as part of CIPM MRA.
The CMC-values of participating laboratories was evaluated by establishing a “Key Comparison Reference Value” (KCRV) and the Degree of Equivalence (EN) between laboratories and KCRV. 

Participants:
TUV NEL (UK)
VSL (The Netherlands)
SP (Sweden)
CENAM (Mexico)
NIST (USA)
AIST (Japan)
KRISS (South Korea)
ITRI (Taiwan)
NIM (China)
UME (Turkey)

contributors.headline: Chief Metrologist Flow at VSL National Metrology Institute

projects.title: Euramet project 1452 Comparison with 20, 50 and 250 L test measures
projects.description:
You can download the comparison report on the website. All NMI's and DI's that took part are visible. 

The aim of this project is to compare the results of the calibrations of a 20, a 50 and a 250 L proving tank. The comparison will allow the participating laboratories to test whether their results and uncertainties are in agreement with the results of the other participants and provide support to the CMC claim for this type of calibration. VNIIM provides the proving tanks that will be used for the comparison. The proving tanks are of the overflow type. The measurements to determine the repeatability of the proving tanks will be performed by VNIIM.

projects.title: BIPM/CIPM key comparison CCM.FF-K4.1.2011 "Volume of Liquids at 20 L and 100 mL"
projects.description:
The participating laboratories determined the volume of water that each of the two Transfer Standards (TS) of 20 L is able to deliver after a 60 second period of dripping-off at a reference temperature of 20 °C; as well as to determine the volume of water that each of the three 100 mL TSs glass pycnometers of the Gay-Lussac type– is able to contain, at a reference temperature of 20 °C.

profile_positions.description:
In my current position I went back to my flow and volume metrology roots but now at a management level as Chief Metrologist Flow. 

I can help you with flow measurements by showing how metrology benefits you and your company by gaining and keeping control over your (flow) measurements.

My first task (September 2022) as Chief Metrologist Flow is to complete the construction and move of the volume laboratory and flow meter calibration facilities in Rotterdam called the European Center for Flow Measurement. 

My personal goal is to give customers the best possible experience when their flow meters, volume instruments, flow calibration facilities or other instruments are calibrated and made traceable to the National Standards of the Netherlands.

We as teamVSL can take care of almost all your needs in Metrology not just Flow. Next to performing calibrations we advise, calculate measurement uncertainty, teach and coach you how to measure better or set up a calibration service. As the National Metrology Institute (NMI) of the Netherlands we have a lot of knowledge that you can use in your day to day business. 

I have visited many companies around the world in all kind of industries. I will remain doing this as I am transferring my knowledge (29+ years) to you and new VSL team members in this field of metrology. Some of the companies I worked for now use a special designed logo of VSL when performing calibration of instruments. This service is called “VSL CMC Certified” and is being introduced in more fields of metrology. 

If you read this I would like to invite you to try our services if you are not our customer yet. I am sure our enthusiastic sales and operation teams will be more than happy to help you.
profile_positions.title: Chief Metrologist Flow

profile_positions.description:
During my time as Manager Liquid Flow I lead a team of metrologists, a scientist and operators dedicated with special tasks. During the first year my main task was to open the LNG flow meter calibration facility for commercial calibrations. We took over the facility when it was operated with liquid nitrogen in an R&D project. We faced many challenges but we managed to get it done! 

In January 2021 I received the task to design a new liquid flow meter calibration facility in a brand new building and location in Rotterdam. Next to this facility the LNG calibration facility needed to move to this location too. In August 2022 the construction of the building and facility are on their way to be completed at the end of 2022. The move of the LNG calibration facility was done by a project team where we added our knowledge about safety and regulations to get a permit for the new location. 

In the meantime the commercial operation and the maintenance of the national standards for the liquid flow department kept going strong. The team calibrated all kind of instruments in the laboratories and on customer locations (not always easy due to the restrictions around Covid-19). We all contributed to consultancy in flow measurement and certification of calibration facilities.
profile_positions.title: Manager Liquid Flow Metrology

profile_positions.description: As Manager Flow Metrology I managed a team of 15+ enthusiastic professionals dedicate to the calibration of flow & volume instruments and Research. Calibration for fluids like natural gas, air, water, liquid nitrogen etc... The Research for traceability for fluids at challenging conditions like LNG and Hydrogen.
profile_positions.title: Manager Flow Metrology

profile_positions.description:
Together with the Manager Calibrations and Reference Materials we managed 45+ enthusiastic professionals dedicate to all fields of metrology like mass, electricity, flow, chemistry and more.

During this time I had for a time responsibilities for the logistics department and during the last year in the manager position for sales, business development and training.
profile_positions.title: Manager Metrology Services at VSL

profile_positions.description:
My work as a senior metrologist for liquid flow and volume existed of the following:

* Maintaining the National Standards for liquid measurements,  
* Calibration of liquid flow meters,
* Calibration of instruments for liquid volume like proving tanks, test measures etc.,
* Calibration of pipe provers and small volume provers,
* VSL CMC Certified certification (visit www.vsl.nl/cmc-flow),
* Design review, testing and uncertainty calculations of calibration facilities,
* Design review, testing and uncertainty calculations of metering systems,
* Training and advice for calibrating flow instruments and other subjects,
* Providing technical assessors for accreditation organizations for ISO/IEC17025,
* ….. ask us..

As manager flow metrology I can still help you with my team on these subjects. 

If you need expertise in the subjects standing above or other liquid flow and volume related topics feel free to contact me at any time. I am sure we can find a solution to all your challenges in measurement at VSL.
profile_positions.title: Senior Metrologist (Liquid flow and volume)

company.name: EURAMET - The European Association of National Metrology Institutes

profile_positions.company: EURAMET - The European Association of National Metrology Institutes
profile_positions.description:
The Technical Committee for Flow (TC-Flow) supports industry, regulation and trade by coordinating and further developing the measurement of fluid quantity and related measurements derived from it (e.g. energy). The measurement of fluid quantities includes all fluids and mixtures of fluids. The primary areas of interest are:
- Measurement and definition of static volume
- Measurement of quantities of water
- Measurement of quantities of hydrocarbon liquids
- Measurement of quantities of high pressure gas
- Measurement of quantities of low pressure gas
- Air (Wind) and water velocity
- Measurement at Micro and Nano scale
- Properties of fluids

The text above from the Euramet TC-Flow webpage: www.euramet.org/technical-committees/tc-f
profile_positions.title: TC-Flow Chairperson

profile_positions.description:
Member of assessment teams to review companies who are accredited by RvA according ISO/IEC17025 and ISO/IEC17020 standards.

During this time I was also part of assesment teams for DAC (UAE), RENAR(RO) and peer reviewer for SAC-SINGLAS (SGP).
profile_positions.title: Technical assessor

profile_positions.description: 1st and 2nd line maintenance F16 fighter. Assist pilots starting up the aircraft, performing inspections and safety checks before, between and after flights.
